etymologies: late Middle English: via Latin from Greek plēktron ‘something with which to strike’, from plēssein ‘to strike’

definitions: a thin flat piece of plastic, tortoiseshell, or other slightly flexible material held by or worn on the fingers and used to pluck the strings of a musical instrument such as a guitar.
shortDefinitions: thin flat piece of plastic, tortoiseshell, or other slightly flexible material held by or worn on fingers and used to pluck strings of musical instrument such as guitar

definitions: the corresponding mechanical part that plucks the strings of an instrument such as a harpsichord.
shortDefinitions: mechanical part corresponding to plectrum which plucks strings of instrument such as harpsichord
